definition: to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: Encourage South Korea ball exercises, collision Chinese fishing boats.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励南韩实弹演习，冲撞中国渔船。

sentences.english: The sea was breaking over the wrecked ship .
sentences.chinese: 海水冲撞着破船的残骸。
稻草减轻了她下跌的冲撞力。

sentences.english: She bumped into me in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 她在黑暗中冲撞在我身上。

sentences.english: The sheep were pollarded to prevent them from ramming the workers.
sentences.chinese: 这羊被截角，防范牠们冲撞了工人。

sentences.english: That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able. Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
sentences.chinese: 该生物此回合若可阻挡冲撞公野猪，则须阻挡之。

sentences.english: A concussion of the spinal cord as a result of an on-field collision.
sentences.chinese: 运动场上的冲撞导致的脊髓震荡。

sentences.english: This is how to complain with impact.
sentences.chinese: 这是如何抱怨冲撞的方法。

sentences.english: The billow of the atlantic dash high on the rock during a storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨时，大西洋的巨浪冲撞岩石掀得很高很高。

sentences.english: The larger fast hits seem to be sucked up perfectly without any hint of bottom out.
sentences.chinese: 更大的快速冲撞力似乎不须压缩至底就能完全被吸收。

sentences.english: It would completely dash any logical sense that Areopagitica still retains.
sentences.chinese: 它完全冲撞了《论出版自由》里保留的所有逻辑性。

sentences.english: In a campaign , Zhao Xuanzi's carriage crashed into the marching troops .
sentences.chinese: 一次战役中，赵宣子的车驾冲撞了行进的队伍。

sentences.english: The colliding interests on Toromocho are part of a tectonic shift in theglobal economy.
sentences.chinese: 在特罗莫克的利益冲撞是环球经济结构调整的一部分。

sentences.english: It had been a ferocious but perfectly legitimate tackle.
sentences.chinese: 这个铲断很凶狠，但确实是合理的冲撞。

definition: lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
collision/crash/to crash together/to collide with/to bump into
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
